items.content:
Windows Build Engineer

About this job

Job type: Full-time
Experience level: Junior, Mid-Level, Senior
Role: Desktop Developer
Industry: Computer Software, SaaS, Software Development / Engineering
Company size: 11–50 people
Company type: Private
Company: ActiveState Software | Vancouver, BC, Canada

Remote details

Preferred Timezone: (GMT-08:00) Pacific Time
Office Location: Vancouver, BC, Canada. Employees can also work full time from this office.

Technologies

python
c++
msvc
msys2
perl

Job description

ActiveState Platform - made by developers for developers! We are reinventing build engineering with an on-demand SaaS Platform and CLI tool that lets developers automate the building of any runtime environment using any open source language ecosystem on any platform. In Beta right now, we support Python and Perl and we're hiring to add more languages and packages! We’re building an ambitious language distribution platform so that no engineer ever has to suffer dependency hell again, and we need your help to do it!

This position is open to full-time telecommuters anywhere in North America. You can also choose to work from our headquarters in beautiful Vancouver, BC.

This position is open to both junior (including fresh out of school) and senior applicants. The rate for this position will be commensurate with your experience.

What You’ll Be Doing

We are looking for someone with experience building software on Windows to help us make our products the best they can be on that platform. You will be teaching the rest of the team more about windows and in turn learning about how we build our products on all of our platforms.

Our day to day work practices are centered around GitHub, pull requests, code review, CI for testing, and agile development with Pivotal Tracker as our project management tool. We’re always looking to improve our practices and we expect you to help us to do so.

Our team is scattered around the US and Canada, so we coordinate with each other and the rest of the company using Slack for chat, Highfive for video calls and screen sharing, Pivotal Tracker, and Google Drive.

We like to use open source software whenever possible, and we also like to contribute back to the open source ecosystem. We embrace open sourcing both libraries and tools developed in-house as long as those are not mission-critical code.

What’s In It For You

  • Working for a stable and growing company that offers the environment and personal growth potential of a start-up.
  • The chance to work with a smart, passionate team of people.
  • Competitive salary, bonus, and stock option plan.
  • Comprehensive benefits package and health/wellness credit program.

Requirements

  • Strong understanding of Microsoft build tools including MSVC, MSVC project files.
  • Understanding of how to build C and C++ code on Windows.
  • Excellent written and spoken skills, both technical and non-technical. You’ll need to work closely with your developer teammates, as well as be able to have coherent conversations with people from QA, sales, marketing, and other parts of the company.
  • A willingness to engage in the process of defining our work through conversations with product management, other engineering teams, and the rest of the company.

Assets

If you have experience with any of the following please make sure to highlight it in your cover letter:

  • Agile processes, including breaking large projects up into smaller stories, estimation, working in branches (GitHub Flow), code review, and CI.
  • Experience with the Msys2 tools on Windows.
  • Experience writing Perl code.
  • Perl, Python, Tcl, or Ruby, especially an understanding of their respective language communities and their toolchains.
  • Big iron operating systems including Solaris, AIX, and HP-UX.
  • Build tools such as make, autotools, bazel, etc.

Working At ActiveState

ActiveState has a collaborative, respectful, and professional culture. We’re all about working together to find the best solutions, and making sure that the experience of doing so is positive for everyone involved. There is a commitment from the CEO on down to making work at ActiveState a great experience for all.

Our company is a team of 40+ and growing, with 2/3rds of the positions in technical roles. We maintain a set of core, overlapping hours, but we’re flexible with specific start and end times and are understanding about appointments and life events.

Our vision is to have an ActiveState solution on every device on every planet, so we certainly don’t lack for ambition! But even though we’re ambitious we don’t expect work to become your life. We know you will do your best work in a positive environment free from death marches. For more about working at ActiveState and our Glassdoor rating go to www.activestate.com/careers.

Try out our Platform for Free!

How To Apply

Please submit your contact info, resume, and a cover letter below. Submissions without a cover letter will not be considered. We look forward to hearing from you!

We are committed to creating a welcoming environment for everyone at ActiveState and we welcome applicants from all walks of life.

Even if you don’t feel you meet every exact requirement, we still would love to hear from you and why you think you would be an awesome addition to our team and we encourage you to apply.

Apply now

About ActiveState Software

If you know Python, Perl, or Tcl you've probably heard of ActiveState's language distros. Now we’re building an ambitious language distribution platform so that no engineer ever has to suffer dependency hell again, and we need your help to do it!

Benefits

  • Weekly meals: Friday lunches and Monday breakfasts
  • Stocked kitchen: snacks, DIY lunch options, drinks and treats!
  • Healthy Lifestyle credit: for your and our planet's health & wellness
  • Bonus program: annual bonus, and cash incentives for meeting goals
  • Benefits package: medical, dental, extended health, vision coverage
  • Friday games: board games, puzzles, Xbox, poker or whatever you choose
  • ActiveVentures: fun quarterly staff outings in and around Vancouver

  • Working for a stable and growing company that offers the environment and personal growth potential of a start-up.
  • The chance to work with a smart, passionate team of people.
  • Competitive salary, bonus, and stock option plan.
  • Comprehensive benefits package and health/wellness credit program.

  • Deep understanding of JavaScript internals and ecosystem
  • Experience with the language your chosen JavaScript distribution is written in (e.g. C/C++ for Node.js) and its build system
  • Excellent written and spoken skills, both technical and non-technical. You’ll need to work closely with your developer teammates, as well as be able to have coherent conversations with people from QA, sales, marketing, and other parts of the company.
  • A willingness to engage in the process of defining our work through conversations with product management, other engineering teams, and the rest of the company.

Assets

If you have experience with any of the following please make sure to highlight it in your cover letter:

  • You are a maintainer or contributor to a core JavaScript distribution or have a popular JavaScript based Open Source project. We make special accommodations to help you maintain those activities.
  • Experience working on a build system.
  • Experience building a JavaScript distribution from source
  • Agile processes, including breaking large projects up into smaller stories, estimation, working in branches (GitHub Flow), code review, and CI.
  • C or C++ code and debugging compiler issues across platforms.
  • Perl, Python, Tcl, or PHP, especially an understanding of their respective language communities and their toolchains.
  • Big iron operating systems including Solaris, AIX, and HP-UX.
  • Build tools such as make, autotools, bazel, etc.

Our vision is to have an ActiveState solution on every device on every planet, so we certainly don’t lack for ambition! But even though we’re ambitious we don’t expect work to become your life. We know you will do your best work in a positive environment free from death marches. For more about working at ActiveState and our Glassdoor rating go to www.activestate.com/careers.

Job description

Guidewire InsuranceNow Implementation Engineer (Developer)

As an Eagle Creek Software Consultant, you will work in a team environment for the successful development and implementation of InsuranceNow.  With this cloud-based solution, you will work from project initiation to full customer product roll out. In this capacity, you will be experienced with the InsuranceNow application, both functionally and technically, in order to customize, configure and test the InsuranceNow application.

In this role, you will provide technical support and effort estimates related to Guidewire InsuranceNow configuration development assignments. While working with other team members, you will propose solutions to improve business unit productivity and/or business results.  In addition to designing configuration solutions that are in line with business needs and requirements, you will also modify existing typelists and/or create new typelists.

To be a part of the Eagle Creek Software Services team you must meet or exceed the following requirements:

  • 5+ years of Java experience
  • Previous experience with InsuranceNow
  • Experience with microservices architecture and containers
  • Object-Oriented Design using SOLID and Hexagonal design principles
  • Experience working with Open Source frameworks such as Spring, Hibernate, jBPM, and others
  • Strong understanding of relational database persistence (e.g. MySQL, Oracle). Familiarity with NoSQL databases (e.g. MongoDB, CouchDB) is a plus
  • Agile development practices
  • Experience designing REST or gRPC based APIs
  • Cloud Services (e.g. AWS/GCP/Azure)
  • Mentoring less experienced engineers
  • Have a passion for technology

Eagle Creek is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer

Apply now

If you would enjoy working in a dynamic environment and are looking for an opportunity to become part of a stellar team of professionals, we invite you to apply online today. 

Eagle Creek is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer. Employment selection and related decisions are made without regard to sex, race, age, disability, religion, national origin, color or any other protected class.

items.content:
Balena

Build Pipeline Engineer

ON BEING A BUILD PIPELINE ENGINEER AT BALENA We strongly believe that the state of the art in software development, testing, and deployment is light years behind what it could be. Balena engineers take pride on accomplishing more with less by exponentially increasing their productivity through automation and internal tooling, and we are never afraid to question established software development practices, and pioneer our own, to improve the way we work. As a build pipeline engineer, you will be working on our cross-platform in-house continuous integration system; on internal tools that range from automatic versioning based on commit conventions, to automated project landing website generation; and on discussing and implementing innovative deployment tools and processes within the distributed systems world. A successful build pipeline engineer is a well-rounded generalist and great communicator that take pride on maximizing the output of their team. They are eager to take responsibility for a project, and are able to make good decisions about the project because they have the context of what's important. We don't require engineers to already be familiar with the technologies we use. We are happy to invest in people that showcase a strong understanding of the challenges of software development, testing, and deployment along with a willingness to learn and grow. RESPONSIBILITIES * Actively invest back into our own technology, libraries, and frameworks * Be highly motivated to produce great code * Maintain the health of our internal build and deployment systems * Implement and maintain internal tools to improve our in-house build and deploy pipeline * Identify parts of our development and deployment cycle that can be automated, and push to make that happen * Challenge orthodoxy when that will help the product evolve * Design, architect, and own the execution of your projects * Collaborate, brainstorm, and coordinate work with other teammates * Understand the high-level goals, and thus know how to prioritize your work REQUIREMENTS Need to have: * Desire to make yourself and others more effective. You'd be bothered by an inefficient process * Good understanding of software engineering practices and how to apply them * Excellent written communication skills, and fluency in English * Self-discipline to take on a project and push it to completion without too much management. items.content:
Build Pipeline Engineer

About this job

Job type: Full-time
Role: System Administrator
Industry: DevOps, Internet of Things, Software Development
Company size: 11–50 people
Company type: VC Funded
Company: Balena | No office location

Technologies

linux
project-management
node.js

Job description

ON BEING A BUILD PIPELINE ENGINEER AT BALENA

We strongly believe that the state of the art in software development, testing, and deployment is light years behind what it could be. Balena engineers take pride on accomplishing more with less by exponentially increasing their productivity through automation and internal tooling, and we are never afraid to question established software development practices, and pioneer our own, to improve the way we work.

As a build pipeline engineer, you will be working on our cross-platform in-house continuous integration system; on internal tools that range from automatic versioning based on commit conventions, to automated project landing website generation; and on discussing and implementing innovative deployment tools and processes within the distributed systems world.

A successful build pipeline engineer is a well-rounded generalist and great communicator that take pride on maximizing the output of their team. They are eager to take responsibility for a project, and are able to make good decisions about the project because they have the context of what's important.

We don't require engineers to already be familiar with the technologies we use. We are happy to invest in people that showcase a strong understanding of the challenges of software development, testing, and deployment along with a willingness to learn and grow.

RESPONSIBILITIES

  • Actively invest back into our own technology, libraries, and frameworks
  • Be highly motivated to produce great code
  • Maintain the health of our internal build and deployment systems
  • Implement and maintain internal tools to improve our in-house build and deploy pipeline
  • Identify parts of our development and deployment cycle that can be automated, and push to make that happen
  • Challenge orthodoxy when that will help the product evolve
  • Design, architect, and own the execution of your projects
  • Collaborate, brainstorm, and coordinate work with other teammates
  • Understand the high-level goals, and thus know how to prioritize your work

REQUIREMENTS

Need to have:

  • Desire to make yourself and others more effective. You'd be bothered by an inefficient process
  • Good understanding of software engineering practices and how to apply them
  • Excellent written communication skills, and fluency in English
  • Self-discipline to take on a project and push it to completion without too much management. You also know when to ask for help
  • Highly organized, able to handle many threads at once, and keep things moving
  • Strong problem-solving abilities. You know how to split a complex problem into incremental pieces
  • Strong programming and software engineering skills
  • Good understanding of git, Docker, and shell scripting

Nice to have:

  • A sample of your work (URL or attached sample)
  • Contributions to OSS projects (please include a URL)
  • Having worked remotely before
  • Experience with balena as a user
  • Experience with embedded GNU/Linux, anything ranging from personal projects with a Raspberry Pi to commercial or industrial scenarios with custom devices
  • Experience with the GitHub API and GitHub Apps Marketplace
  • Experience with cross-platform application development (macOS, Windows, and GNU/Linux)
  • Experience with Concourse CI and Kubernetes
  • Experience in the Node.js and Rust ecosystem

Make sure to let us know if any of these items apply to you!

BENEFITS

  • Work with an extremely talented, diverse team
  • Equipment of your choice
  • Remote-friendly
  • Flexible working hours
  • Generous vacation policy
  • Annual company gathering in an international location - this year, Barcelona in October
  • We send you hardware for side projects!

ABOUT WORKING AT BALENA

We come from 15+ countries, and we embrace a remote culture with flexible hours. To us, this means being highly productive while still maintaining a healthy work-life balance. You need to be able to work remotely, and have a dependable internet access available so you can join video calls.

We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity. We value knowledge and initiative more than educational and personal backgrounds, age, or location. We maintain a work environment in which team members are treated with respect at all times and in which thoughts and ideas can be shared openly.

We communicate proposals, discuss with others in the team and accept feedback if it makes the result better. We value the ability to learn, which is more important to us than knowledge of specific technologies. We know that learning fast means being outside our comfort zone, which is OK -- we'd rather learn than let our assumptions get in our way.

TO APPLY

We're delighted to hear about you! Send us your CV, with a focus on what you can bring to the team. Please include in your cover letter a paragraph about something you worked on that you found technically appealing or exciting.

Apply now

About Balena

Balena provides a software platform that helps developers build, deploy and manage code on connected devices. We brought Docker to embedded GNU/Linux devices in 2013 and have been building our IoT toolkit ever since. We also maintain a variety of successful open source projects including Etcher, openBalena, balenaEngine, and balenaOS, and made contributions to high-exposure projects such as Docker, Electron, and AppImage.

Our technology is open, standards-based, and proven in production across a wide range of scenarios from drones, 3D printers, point-of-sale devices, tidal turbines, skyscrapers and more. Our investors include DFJ, Aspect Ventures, GE, and Ericsson.

Balena is a highly distributed, remote-friendly company with a pretty much flat hierarchy. Our organization is adaptive, getting feedback signals from our users and systems. Right now we organize ourselves by projects, which allow us to build complex features and solve big problems, while staying mutable. As a distributed group, we rely on clear communication and the rule of "assume positive intent" to help us work together across time zones, cultures and first languages. Our base of operations is nominally London, though really we are living all over the world: from Barcelona to Bulgaria, Argentina to Vietnam, and many more.

Benefits

  • Work with extremely talented, distributed team
  • Work remotely
  • Flexible working hours
  • Equipment of your choice
  • Annual company gathering in an international location
  • We send you hardware for side projects!

items.content:
Minimum Required Skills:
Jenkins, Python, Amazon Web Services, Building / Compiling, debugging services, Linux Administration, Windows Administration, API Design, Writing / Signing Windows MSI packages, Working Remote

This position is 100% REMOTE / Work from home - required experience is Python + Jenkins while AWS, Bamboo + Security is a plus!

We are fast growing, extremely well funded and now established startup in the cloud security and data analysis space. We are backed by huge partners including significant investment by Google Ventures.

We are seeking a talented Build Engineer who is interested in pushing their boundaries and taking on a role that involves significant work in an environment that relies on extremely reliable build / release engineering.

Our team uses technologies that include Python, AWS (lots of services) and Bamboo / Jenkins for CI.

If you are a Software Engineer and you like solving problems, finding and fixing issues, improving application performance and contributing to high transaction, high availability applications and you're interested in a role that's responsible for Blue / Green Release Architecture, Continuous Integration and working with a modern open source stack that includes Python, Bamboo and Jenkins, please read on.

Top Reasons to Work with Us

- We are one of the fastest growing startups in america right now (for real)
- Work with modern technologies
- Leverage the performance, power, and scalability of modern cloud computing best practices
- A new product that is revolutionizing cloud data, cloud security and real time cloud processing
- Solve challenging problems for a platform that has incredibly high transactions and an absurd amount of data / big data and big data processing

What You Will Be Doing

- Working as part of a build team that will be working to build / release code written in Python and GoLang
- Working w/ Bamboo and Jenkins
- Participating in Blue / Green Architecture / Deployment / automated build / release and deployment engineering
- Work on complex Builds that communicated w/ AWS and are highly scalable

What You Need for this Position

Experience w/ the following:

- Python + Jenkins expertise is a MUST

The following are all nice to haves:
- Bamboo
- Strong knowledge of Continuous Integration
- AWS
- Windows MSI Packages
- Linux & Windows Administration

What's In It for You

Super cool company culture - very well funded startup, proven industry executives, great company culture, bleeding edge technology stack
Work on extremely challenging and thought provoking problems
Great base salary + equity + bonus + PTO and great other benefits too!So, If you are a Build Engineer and you like solving problems, finding and fixing issues, improving application performance and contributing to high transaction, high availability applications and you're interested in a role that's responsible for Build Engineering w/ a modern open source stack that includes Python, Bamboo and Jenkins, please apply!

Applicants must be authorized to work in the U.S.Please apply directly to by clicking 'Click Here to Apply' with your Word resume!

Looking forward to receiving your resume and going over the position in more detail with you.

- Not a fit for this position? Click the link at the bottom of this email to search all of our open positions.

Looking forward to receiving your resume!

tags: DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=0, other=0, dotnet=0, c=0, mobile=0, go=0, nodejs=0, bigdata-ml=0, ruby=0, apple=0, java=0, gamedev=0, php=0, embedded=0, frontend=5}
items.content:
Live IT Up at Ciber Global

At Ciber Global, we believe the most inspired, innovative and industrious companies should win, regardless of size or legacy. We're the small company that cares and the big company that can. We deliver breakthrough performances and powerful solutions that are anything but cookie cutter in order to give our clients the competitive advantage they deserve.

Work.

Are you looking for an opportunity that is 100% Remote from your home? Are excellent benefits important to you? If so, please keep reading, this could be that opportunity!

Purpose of Position:
  • This position is responsible for the implementation and support of interfaces between Client's systems and customer systems.
This position requires previous experience with implementing applications and verifying HL7 messages are in compliance with HL7 Standards

Job Responsibilities :
  • Performs and facilitates testing and support, provide overall project leadership to ensure hospital and Physician client interfaces conform to the client's HL7 standards.
  • Responsible for multiple implementations or conversion projects.
  • Participates for information gathering for interface requirements
  • Educates and directly interacts with the client to help them understand the benefits and limitations of their specific EMR/LIS-Interface during implementation.
  • Provides direct interaction with client and client's vendor -Designs and oversees interface implementation project plan.
  • Responsible for providing project status updates.
  • Will provide communications such as go-live notices, support documentation and operational checklists to our internal organization relative to any new or change to existing client interface.
  • Implementation of communication scripts and protocols to include VPN and frame and web services.
  • Provides 3rd tier support (as defined in the Support SOP) to EMR/LIS-Interface related problems.
  • Provides post implementation support
  • Responsible for escalating implementation and support issues to appropriate persons or groups for resolution.
  • Meets productivity requirements for this position
  • Other duties as assigned
Working Conditions:
  • Office Environment.
  • Home Office Environment.
  • This position may require some travel. Less than 10%
Occupational Exposure:
  • Subjected to limited amounts when working with technical users.
  • Physical Demands:
  • Typical and mixed amounts of standing, walking, and sitting.
  • Heavy lifting is not expected.
Education:
  • College degree desirable or equivalent experience.
Experience:

Required 2-5 years' experience in medical lab operations and/or IT functions.
  • Experience in Hospital LIS system is ideal (Meditech, Cerner, Epic, etc)
  • Exposure to clinical healthcare environment.
  • Working knowledge of testing life cycle, including accessioning, resulting, and report compare.
  • Ability to manage projects with little or no supervision.
  • Excellent written and verbal communications skills.
  • Strong customer service skills.
  • Strong problem solving and analytical skills.
  • Strong organizational skills and ability to multitask.
  • Ability to understand HL7 standards and previous experience with message structure.
  • Proficiency in working with Microsoft office suite. Must be familiar with Excel, Outlook, and MS Project. Familiarity with Access a plus.
  • Familiarity with a commercial Integration Engine Product a plus, including Cloverleaf and Rhapsody.
Must be familiar with HL7 Standards

Solid Project Coordination skills

Excellent Customer Service phone skills

Excellent ability to multitask

Word

Excel

Powerpoint

Senior Integration Developer - Dell Boomi , Netsuite, Salesforce, EDI

LOCATION: Tampa, Florida & Remote

Contract Role

Requirements:

Role : Dell Boomi Integration Developer

Role Description: Design, develop, architect Boomi integration processes

Must have Skills: Dell Boomi. / Dell Boomi Certification / Netsuite & Salesforce integration experience.

A. 2 years of Experience in application integration using Dell Boomi. 8+ years Integration & Architecture experience.
B. Proficient in building, deploying and scheduling complex integration processes.
C. Experience in building application integrations with Netsuite and Salesforce applications is a plus. EDI experience with Boomi will be an advantage.
D. Strong presentation and communication skills, shall able to work on multiple integration projects and lead a team of integration developers.

Apply with resume and availability

tags: DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=16, other=0, dotnet=32, c=0, mobile=0, go=8, nodejs=0, bigdata-ml=0, ruby=0, apple=0, java=0, gamedev=0, php=0, embedded=0, frontend=0}
items.content:
Minimum Required Skills:
Jenkins, Python, Amazon Web Services, Building / Compiling, debugging services, Linux Administration, Windows Administration, API Design, Writing / Signing Windows MSI packages, Working Remote

This position is 100% REMOTE / Work from home - required experience is Python + Jenkins while AWS, Bamboo + Security is a plus!

We are fast growing, extremely well funded and now established startup in the cloud security and data analysis space. We are backed by huge partners including significant investment by Google Ventures.

We are seeking a talented Build Engineer who is interested in pushing their boundaries and taking on a role that involves significant work in an environment that relies on extremely reliable build / release engineering.

Our team uses technologies that include Python, AWS (lots of services) and Bamboo / Jenkins for CI.

If you are a Software Engineer and you like solving problems, finding and fixing issues, improving application performance and contributing to high transaction, high availability applications and you're interested in a role that's responsible for Blue / Green Release Architecture, Continuous Integration and working with a modern open source stack that includes Python, Bamboo and Jenkins, please read on.

Top Reasons to Work with Us

- We are one of the fastest growing startups in america right now (for real)
- Work with modern technologies
- Leverage the performance, power, and scalability of modern cloud computing best practices
- A new product that is revolutionizing cloud data, cloud security and real time cloud processing
- Solve challenging problems for a platform that has incredibly high transactions and an absurd amount of data / big data and big data processing

What You Will Be Doing

- Working as part of a build team that will be working to build / release code written in Python and GoLang
- Working w/ Bamboo and Jenkins
- Participating in Blue / Green Architecture / Deployment / automated build / release and deployment engineering
- Work on complex Builds that communicated w/ AWS and are highly scalable

What You Need for this Position

Experience w/ the following:

- Python + Jenkins expertise is a MUST

The following are all nice to haves:
- Bamboo
- Strong knowledge of Continuous Integration
- AWS
- Windows MSI Packages
- Linux & Windows Administration

What's In It for You

Super cool company culture - very well funded startup, proven industry executives, great company culture, bleeding edge technology stack
Work on extremely challenging and thought provoking problems
Great base salary + equity + bonus + PTO and great other benefits too!So, If you are a Build Engineer and you like solving problems, finding and fixing issues, improving application performance and contributing to high transaction, high availability applications and you're interested in a role that's responsible for Build Engineering w/ a modern open source stack that includes Python, Bamboo and Jenkins, please apply!

Applicants must be authorized to work in the U.S.Please apply directly to by clicking 'Click Here to Apply' with your Word resume!

Looking forward to receiving your resume and going over the position in more detail with you.

- Not a fit for this position? Click the link at the bottom of this email to search all of our open positions.

Looking forward to receiving your resume!

CyberCoders

CyberCoders, Inc is proud to be an Equal Opportunity Employer

All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, disability, protected veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law.

Your Right to Work - In compliance with federal law, all persons hired will be required to verify identity and eligibility to work in the United States and to complete the required employment eligibility verification document form upon hire.

items.title: REMOTE Middleware Developer / Architect (Automation)
tags: DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=0, other=0, dotnet=0, c=0, mobile=0, go=3, nodejs=0, bigdata-ml=0, ruby=0, apple=0, java=24, gamedev=0, php=0, embedded=0, frontend=0}
items.content:
Middleware Developer (Automation)

REMOTE

  • A Middleware developer (WAS, Apache, TomCat, Playbook, Ansible) that understands how DevOps functions. Understand how to check their code into Git and how Jenkins monitors it, cognizant of the automation testing, putting the new test cases into the DevOps pipeline, if it fails being able to turn it around and watch it go through the testing again. Make sure the Middleware is easy to understand and work with not only by the developer but by the team.

Top skills (not all required):

  • Full Stack Engineer with focus on automation and Middleware Development - must have
  • 5+ years experience
  • Architect experience a plus
  • Ansible
  • WAS - preferred
  • TomCat - preferred
  • Apache - preferred
  • Developing Playbooks
  • Linux
  • Knowledge of micro-services
  • DevOps experience a plus
  • CI/CD (continuous integration / continual delivery)

Day to day responsibilities:

  • Heads down Architect / developer
  • Agile environment
  • Work through 2 to 4-week releases
  • Daily stand ups in morning
  • During releases need to show work accomplished
  • A generalist working on frontend, backend, and anything it takes to solve problems.
  • Work with a broad range of systems, processes and technologies to own and solve problems. Collaborate with stakeholders across the infrastructure and operations organizations.
  • Can stitch together disparate services and processes together.
  • Enjoy working with a diverse group of people with different expertise.
  • A strong appetite for learning and an ability to leverage what you learn to make our products better
- provided by Dice

tags: DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=4, other=15, dotnet=48, c=29, mobile=0, go=3, nodejs=0, bigdata-ml=0, ruby=2, apple=0, java=0, gamedev=0, php=0, embedded=0, frontend=0}
items.content:
ActiveState Software

Windows Build Engineer


If you know Python, Perl, or Tcl you've probably heard of ActiveState's language distros. Now we’re building an ambitious language distribution platform so that no engineer ever has to suffer dependency hell again, and we need your help to do it!

This position is open to full-time telecommuters anywhere in North America. You can also choose to work from our headquarters in beautiful Vancouver, BC.

This position is open to both junior (including fresh out of school) and senior applicants. The rate for this position will be commensurate with your experience.

What You’ll Be Doing

We are looking for someone with experience building software on Windows to help us make our products the best they can be on that platform. You will be teaching the rest of the team more about windows and in turn learning about how we build our products on all of our platforms.

Our day to day work practices are centered around GitHub, pull requests, code review, CI for testing, and agile development with Pivotal Tracker as our project management tool. We’re always looking to improve our practices and we expect you to help us to do so.

Our team is scattered around the US and Canada, so we coordinate with each other and the rest of the company using Slack for chat, Highfive for video calls and screen sharing, Pivotal Tracker, and Google Drive.

We like to use open source software whenever possible, and we also like to contribute back to the open source ecosystem. We embrace open sourcing both libraries and tools developed in-house as long as those are not mission-critical code.

What’s In It For You


* Working for a stable and growing company that offers the environment and personal growth potential of a start-up.

* The chance to work with a smart, passionate team of people.

* Competitive salary, bonus, and stock option plan.

* Comprehensive benefits package and health/wellness credit program.




Requirements


* Strong understanding of Microsoft build tools including MSVC, MSVC project files.

* Understanding of how to build C and C++ code on Windows.

* Excellent written and spoken skills, both technical and non-technical. You’ll need to work closely with your developer teammates, as well as be able to have coherent conversations with people from QA, sales, marketing, and other parts of the company.

* A willingness to engage in the process of defining our work through conversations with product management, other engineering teams, and the rest of the company.




Assets

If you have experience with any of the following please make sure to highlight it in your cover letter:


* Agile processes, including breaking large projects up into smaller stories, estimation, working in branches (GitHub Flow), code review, and CI.

* Experience with the Msys2 tools on Windows.

* Experience writing Perl code.

* Perl, Python, Tcl, or Ruby, especially an understanding of their respective language communities and their toolchains.

* Big iron operating systems including Solaris, AIX, and HP-UX.

* Build tools such as make, autotools, bazel, etc.




Working At ActiveState

ActiveState has a collaborative, respectful, and professional culture. We’re all about working together to find the best solutions, and making sure that the experience of doing so is positive for everyone involved. There is a commitment from the CEO on down to making work at ActiveState a great experience for all.

Our company is a team of 40+ and growing, with 2/3rds of the positions in technical roles. We maintain a set of core, overlapping hours, but we’re flexible with specific start and end times and are understanding about appointments and life events.

Our vision is to have an ActiveState solution on every device on every planet, so we certainly don’t lack for ambition! But even though we’re ambitious we don’t expect work to become your life. We know you will do your best work in a positive environment free from death marches. For more about working at ActiveState and our Glassdoor rating go to www.activestate.com/careers.

How To Apply

Please submit your contact info, resume, and a cover letter below. Submissions without a cover letter will not be considered. We look forward to hearing from you!

We are committed to creating a welcoming environment for everyone at ActiveState and we welcome applicants from all walks of life.

Even if you don’t feel you meet every exact requirement, we still would love to hear from you and why you think you would be an awesome addition to our team and we encourage you to apply.

items.content:
ActiveState Software

Ruby Language Specialist Build Engineer


At ActiveState we have made a name for ourselves providing language distros for Perl, Python and TCL. Now we’re building an ambitious Platform to build and distribute every language on the platform so that no engineer ever has to suffer dependency hell again, and we need your help to add Ruby to it!

This position is open to full-time telecommuters anywhere in North America. You can also choose to work from our headquarters in beautiful Vancouver, BC.

This position is open to both junior (including fresh out of school) and senior applicants. The salary for this position will be commensurate with your experience.

What You’ll Be Doing

As a Ruby Language Specialist on our team, you are responsible for using your deep understanding of Ruby; it’s internals, dependency management, idioms and community to teach our Platform to build and distribute Ruby for multiple Operating Systems.  You'll be responsible for building a Ruby runtime from its source code and writing software to consume everything in the Ruby ecosystem.  Note this is not a Ruby development role, rather you'll be writing software to create custom Ruby distributions and this software won't necessarily be written in Ruby.

Our day to day work practices are centered around GitHub, pull requests, code review, CI for testing, and agile development with Pivotal Tracker as our project management tool. We’re always looking to improve our practices and we expect you to help us to do so.

Our team is scattered around the US and Canada, so we coordinate with each other and the rest of the company using Slack for chat, Highfive for video calls and screen sharing, Pivotal Tracker, and Google Drive.

We like to use open source software whenever possible, and we also like to contribute back to the open source ecosystem. We embrace open sourcing both libraries and tools developed in-house as long as those are not mission-critical code.

What’s In It For You


* Working for a stable and growing company that offers the environment and personal growth potential of a start-up.

* The chance to work with a smart, passionate team of people.

* Competitive salary, bonus, and stock option plan.

* Comprehensive benefits package and health/wellness credit program.




Requirements


* Deep understanding of Ruby internals and ecosystem

* Experience with C programming on multiple operating systems (Windows/UNIX/OSX) and the Ruby build system

* Excellent written and spoken skills, both technical and non-technical. You’ll need to work closely with your developer teammates, as well as be able to have coherent conversations with people from QA, sales, marketing, and other parts of the company.

* A willingness to engage in the process of defining our work through conversations with product management, other engineering teams, and the rest of the company.




Assets

If you have experience with any of the following please make sure to highlight it in your cover letter:


* You are a maintainer, contributor to the core Ruby code base or have a popular Ruby based Open Source project. We make special accommodations to help you maintain those activities.

* Experience working on a build system.

* Experience building the core Ruby language runtime from source code

* Agile processes, including breaking large projects up into smaller stories, estimation, working in branches (GitHub Flow), code review, and CI.

* C or C++ code and debugging compiler issues across platforms.

* Perl, Python, Tcl, or Ruby, especially an understanding of their respective language communities and their toolchains.

* Big iron operating systems including Solaris, AIX, and HP-UX.

* Build tools such as make, autotools, bazel, etc.




Working At ActiveState

ActiveState has a collaborative, respectful, and professional culture. We’re all about working together to find the best solutions, and making sure that the experience of doing so is positive for everyone involved. There is a commitment from the CEO on down to making work at ActiveState a great experience for all.

Our company is a team of 40+ and growing, with 2/3rds of the positions in technical roles. We maintain a set of core, overlapping hours, but we’re flexible with specific start and end times and are understanding about appointments and life events.

Our vision is to have an ActiveState solution on every device on every planet, so we certainly don’t lack for ambition! But even though we’re ambitious we don’t expect work to become your life. We know you will do your best work in a positive environment free from death marches. For more about working at ActiveState and our Glassdoor rating go to www.activestate.com/careers.

ActiveState has a collaborative, respectful, and professional culture. We’re all about working together to find the best solutions, and making sure that the experience of doing so is positive for everyone involved. There is a commitment from the CEO on down to making work at ActiveState a great experience for all.

Our company is a team of 40+ and growing, with 2/3rds of the positions in technical roles. We maintain a set of core, overlapping hours, but we’re flexible with specific start and end times and are understanding about appointments and life events.

Our vision is to have an ActiveState solution on every device on every planet, so we certainly don’t lack for ambition! But even though we’re ambitious we don’t expect work to become your life. We know you will do your best work in a positive environment free from death marches. For more about working at ActiveState and our Glassdoor rating go to .

Apply now

items.content:
Senior Release Engineer

Company: Dashlane
Location: Lisbon, PT
Remote location: Partially remote
Level: Senior
Language: English
DevOps / Sysadmin
Skills:
  • Continuous Deployment
  • Continuous Integration
  • Docker
  • Terraform
  • Version Control

    • Intro

    Dashlane is looking for a Release Engineer in Lisbon to support our growth. The primary purpose of this role is to help us scale and industrialize our current multi-platform release pipeline that enables our product development teams to own and run their release processes. 

    You will support all phases of the software life-cycle - including multi-platform build systems, continuous integration, crash reporting, code coverage, analysis tools, and test environments, to allow our code and features to be released in a streamlined and automated way, from development to production.

    In collaboration with the engineering teams and in an agile and cross-platform environment, you will design, implement, document, improve and maintain a solid release infrastructure that optimizes our development speed, accelerates our agile delivery cadence, while still providing a very high degree of stability and reliability for our customers. 

    Main requirements

    • Proficient with version control, continuous integration, and multi-platform development environments
    • Expertise in automating release and build processes
    • CI tools experience like Gitlab, Jenkins or Bamboo.
    • Have hands on experience in coding and scripting in one or more programming languages (Java, typescript, python, bash, etc).
    • Knowledge of Docker and/or Kubernetes
    • Experience with configuration management tools (ansible, terraform, puppet, packer);
    • Great oral and written communication in English.


    Perks

    • Flexible Working Hours;
    • A MacBook Pro and a height adjustable standing Desk;
    • Opportunity to take part in an International Team;
    • Being one of the first employees in our Lisbon office, you will have the chance to participate to the construction of team culture and recruitment of your next colleagues ;)

items.title: CommentSold: Mobile Build Automation Engineer
tags: DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=4, other=1, dotnet=0, c=0, mobile=28, go=6, nodejs=0, bigdata-ml=0, ruby=0, apple=6, java=3, gamedev=0, php=0, embedded=0, frontend=0}
items.content:
Mobile Build Automation Engineer

Mobile Build Automation Engineer (Remote)

CommentSold is a rapidly growing social commerce platform revolutionizing the way online retailers do business.

We strive to make shopping simple and fun by allowing real-time interactions while empowering entrepreneurs to become the next generation of retailers through social media, websites, and mobile apps.

The platform encompasses a robust feature set for managing the day-to-day operations, including, automated invoicing, sales analytics, customer data, and inventory details that help owners make quick, informed business decisions.

About the Role

At CommentSold we provide our shops with native mobile apps for both iOS and Android as part of that process we have automation and build/release processes for everything from generating the initial app, to updating, building and submitting the application.

We’re seeking an experienced engineer with a background in Mobile and Build and Release processes to take ownership over our app automation systems. In this role you’ll be driving forward our mobile build automation using tools like fastlane, xcodegen, scripting and integrations with app store systems.

This role will be responsible for all of our new app releases, improving and iterating on the automation pipeline, building a system to allow our shops to manage their applications and much more.

Technical Stack

We currently support native apps for iOS and Android, our pipeline uses libraries and tooling along with scripts/tools written in languages including python, bash and go.

Your Skills and Experience:

  • Degree in Computer Science/Technical field of study OR commensurate experience
  • At least 4 years of professional experience in mobile or build/release engineering roles
  • Hands on experience with one of iOS/Android and with python or go
  • Proven experience in shipping mobile apps on the App Store and/or Google Play store
  • You’re comfortable working independently and solving evolving technical problems
  • Strong understanding of core mobile technologies
  • Experience in building web applications and web based management systems

Benefits

  • Remote oriented team and workflow
  • Your pick of development hardware
  • Home internet reimbursement
  • Coworking space reimbursement

Requirements
  • Only candidates located in North America will be considered at this time

items.title: Workday Integration Consultant (Nationwide/Remote)
tags: DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=0, other=0, dotnet=8, c=0, mobile=1, go=0, nodejs=0, bigdata-ml=0, ruby=0, apple=0, java=2, gamedev=0, php=0, embedded=0, frontend=0}
items.content:
Job Description

As a Workday Integration Consultant, you will design, build, configure and test integration systems between the Workday cloud-based HRIS and various other systems, including external vendors, to meet the specific needs of the client. Foster the development of other Consultants by sharing expertise. May support proposal preparations, deliver demonstrations to clients and speak at conferences. This position is a remote/work from home role.

The ideal candidate will already have a current (within 2 versions) Workday Integration Core Partner (not Pro) certification. Other candidates may be considered for junior-level positions if they have some of the following:

  • Workday Pro (Customer) training/certifications
  • Workday integration experience
  • Consulting experience
  • Software Development experience, especially experience with XSLT and/or EDI.

Key Responsibilities:

  • Work on client engagements as a contributor; may lead small projects
  • Build and maintain relationships with implementation teams
  • Keep Project/Engagement Managers and stakeholder teams apprised of overall project status
  • Mentor junior consultants and/or lead teams
  • Provide input on delivery estimation and resource planning to business leads where required
  • Lead discovery sessions with customer subject matter experts across various technical integration areas in delivering high-level design documentation
  • Manage competing priorities
  • Provide feedback internally on project/product where areas of improvement are identified
  • Advise customers on adoption of Workday integrations and security best practices
  • Ensure the client is referenceable once the client is in production
  • Participate in update training and other events that help share one s integration & product skills with other consultants
  • Use field experience and product expertise to support our pre-sales organization in talking with prospective customers
  • Assist in building ongoing relationships with customers to promote Intecrowd s continued growth and success

Qualifications for a Staff/Senior level position:

Basic Qualifications

  • Current Workday Integration Certification Required
  • 1-3 years implementing Workday integrations
  • 1-3 years of HCM/ERP software application experience with EDI, Web Services, SOAP, REST, XML, XSLT, Java, .Net or other integration technologies
  • 3-5 years integrating systems with third-party service vendors
  • Previous consulting experience with a consulting/software company
  • Experience with and understanding of Human Resources data
  • Business, Process, and Data Analysis skills
  • Excellent communication and interpersonal skills
  • Good negotiation and facilitation skills
  • Ability to work proactively and independently within a project framework
  • Willingness to advance technically and earn additional Workday certifications

Preferred Qualifications

  • At least 1 additional integration certification (Studio, CCTPP, CCB, Fin Int)
  • Strong interest in collaborative work with clients
  • Proven ability to work within a team-oriented environment
  • Proven ability to work creatively and analytically in a problem-solving environment
  • Ability to operate effectively in a dynamic, growing, ecosystem with minimal supervision
  • Excellent communication (written and oral) and interpersonal skills
  • Bachelor s Degree (or higher) with a focus in technology

Working Conditions:

  • Remote work with occasional onsite customer and/or internal business travel
  • Shifts and/or schedules may change throughout the year/tenure as dictated by management and business needs
  • May be required to sit and review information on a computer screen for long periods of time.
  • May require repetitive motions of the hands and wrist related to writing and typing at an electronic keyboard.

Equal Opportunity Statement:

All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, disability, or status as a Vietnam or disabled veteran.

Applications for employment in the US must have work authorization that does not now or in the future require sponsorship of a visa for employment authorization in the United States and with Intecrowd.

Company Description

Intecrowd is a rapidly growing boutique Workday services partner. We are an all-remote company with about 150 employees throughout the United States and five other countries.

OUR VISION
To be the go-to partner for solving key problems faced by Workday and the ecosystem and ultimately deliver exceptional value, higher efficiency, and improved customer satisfaction.

GUIDING PRINCIPLES
We focus on delivering superior value and increased marginal utility to our customers
We strive for excellence in all of our efforts
We are totally committed to quality and continuous improvement
We pursue strategic knowledge
Work should be an enjoyable part of a well-rounded life
Integrity is never compromised
We believe in treating all individuals as we wish to be treated
WE VALUE
People
Teamwork
Thinking and acting strategically
Innovation
Trust
Agility

Data Integration Engineer - 1 days telecommute!

Exciting opportunity for an Integration Engineer to join an award winning software company in the healthcare industry!

This is a hands-on role where you will be responsible for developing, enhancing, and supporting new and existing products. The position will support and build new integrations between our software product and other external systems. Additionally, you will be responsible for working with the development team to build new applications and ensure solid technical design, coding, testing and deployment of integrations.

Enjoy this direct-hire position in Dunwoody that offers flexible work hours and 1-2 days telecommute after 90 day review! Don't miss out on working with a fun, high energy and collaborative team, with the opportunity to truly make an impact and grow your career!

REQUIRED EXPERIENCE:

  • 3+ years experience with API integrations
  • Exposure to or light experience with integration of Server Side C# for the .NET API layer
  • XML, JSON, SQL
  • Networking and authentication methodologies

PREFERRED EXPERIENCE:

  • HL7 and FHIR formats, parsers and structures
  • WCF
  • Mirth Connect
  • Jira or Atlassian

items.content:
Minimum Required Skills:
Jenkins, Python, Amazon Web Services, Building / Compiling, debugging services, Linux Administration, Windows Administration, API Design, Writing / Signing Windows MSI packages, Working Remote

This position is 100% REMOTE / Work from home - required experience is Python + Jenkins while AWS, Bamboo + Security is a plus!

We are fast growing, extremely well funded and now established startup in the cloud security and data analysis space. We are backed by huge partners including significant investment by Google Ventures.

We are seeking a talented Build Engineer who is interested in pushing their boundaries and taking on a role that involves significant work in an environment that relies on extremely reliable build / release engineering.

Our team uses technologies that include Python, AWS (lots of services) and Bamboo / Jenkins for CI.

If you are a Software Engineer and you like solving problems, finding and fixing issues, improving application performance and contributing to high transaction, high availability applications and you're interested in a role that's responsible for Blue / Green Release Architecture, Continuous Integration and working with a modern open source stack that includes Python, Bamboo and Jenkins, please read on.

Top Reasons to Work with Us

- We are one of the fastest growing startups in america right now (for real)
- Work with modern technologies
- Leverage the performance, power, and scalability of modern cloud computing best practices
- A new product that is revolutionizing cloud data, cloud security and real time cloud processing
- Solve challenging problems for a platform that has incredibly high transactions and an absurd amount of data / big data and big data processing

What You Will Be Doing

- Working as part of a build team that will be working to build / release code written in Python and GoLang
- Working w/ Bamboo and Jenkins
- Participating in Blue / Green Architecture / Deployment / automated build / release and deployment engineering
- Work on complex Builds that communicated w/ AWS and are highly scalable

What You Need for this Position

Experience w/ the following:

- Python + Jenkins expertise is a MUST

The following are all nice to haves:
- Bamboo
- Strong knowledge of Continuous Integration
- AWS
- Windows MSI Packages
- Linux & Windows Administration

What's In It for You

Super cool company culture - very well funded startup, proven industry executives, great company culture, bleeding edge technology stack
Work on extremely challenging and thought provoking problems
Great base salary + equity + bonus + PTO and great other benefits too!So, If you are a Build Engineer and you like solving problems, finding and fixing issues, improving application performance and contributing to high transaction, high availability applications and you're interested in a role that's responsible for Build Engineering w/ a modern open source stack that includes Python, Bamboo and Jenkins, please apply!

Applicants must be authorized to work in the U.S.Please apply directly to by clicking 'Click Here to Apply' with your Word resume!

Looking forward to receiving your resume and going over the position in more detail with you.

- Not a fit for this position? Click the link at the bottom of this email to search all of our open positions.

Looking forward to receiving your resume!

items.title: Workday Integration Specialist-Remote
tags: DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=2, other=5, dotnet=0, c=0, mobile=0, go=0, nodejs=0, bigdata-ml=0, ruby=2, apple=0, java=0, gamedev=0, php=0, embedded=0, frontend=0}
items.content:
Job Title: Workday Integration Specialist
100% Remote position
Contract Duration: 9 months (possible extension)

W2 Only
Job Summary:
Client is looking for a senior level contractor to join their team implementing Workday Cloud HCM and ADP Global payroll systems. In this role, you will work as a member of the IT Enterprise Application Integration (IT-EAI) team. You will be a key member of the team, responsible for design, development, testing and deploying integrations between Workday, ADP, and a range of third party SaaS solutions. Successful candidates will be well versed in Workday integration capabilities, including core connectors, calculated fields, enterprise integration builder (EIB), and/or Workday studio. As a senior technical contractor, you will contribute to the team s capabilities by demonstrating technical competence, initiative, creativity, learning, sharing, and teamwork while collaborating with globally distributed team members and stakeholders. The IT-EAI team has a presence in Raleigh, NC, but also has many remote associates. Remote candidates with required skills and demonstrated success working independently are encouraged to apply.

Primary Job responsibilities:

  • Analyze and clarify business requirements and functional specifications
  • Collaborate with third-party system integrators to design appropriate solutions for a variety of business processes
  • Develop and test services enabling complex integration use cases
  • Support project integration and end-to-end test cycles
  • Document solutions to facilitate long-term operational support
  • Document and transfer knowledge, develop capabilities of production support team

Required Skills:

  • Bachelor s degree or higher, or international equivalent, in a science or technology field
  • 7+ years experience with industry leading HCM solutions
  • 3+ years experience with Workday integration capabilities, including cloud connect, core connectors, EIB, Studio, RaaS, PICOF, PECI and more
  • Foundational understanding of security protocols, including SSH/SFTP, SSL/TLS, and PGP/GnuPG
  • Ability to mentor teammates and improve their skills on Workday integration technologies
  • Excellent verbal and written English communication skills
  • Prior experience working on agile development teams (Scrum, Kanban) is a plus

Preferred Skills:

  • Experience with test automation
  • Hands on experience with python, perl, ruby, or similar scripting language
  • Knowledge of Oracle EBS HCM or financials suite is a plus
  • Workday integration certification is a plus
- provided by Dice

items.content:
Data Integration Engineer - 1 days telecommute!

Exciting opportunity for an Integration Engineer to join an award winning software company in the healthcare industry!

This is a hands-on role where you will be responsible for developing, enhancing, and supporting new and existing products. The position will support and build new integrations between our software product and other external systems. Additionally, you will be responsible for working with the development team to build new applications and ensure solid technical design, coding, testing and deployment of integrations.

Enjoy this direct-hire position in Dunwoody that offers flexible work hours and 1-2 days telecommute after 90 day review! Don't miss out on working with a fun, high energy and collaborative team, with the opportunity to truly make an impact and grow your career!

REQUIRED EXPERIENCE:

  • 3+ years experience with API integrations
  • Exposure to or light experience with with integration of server side C# for the .NET API layer
  • XML, JSON, SQL
  • Networking and authentication methodologies

PREFERRED EXPERIENCE:

  • HL7 and FHIR formats, parsers and structures
  • WCF
  • Mirth Connect
  • Jira or Atlassian

Must be authorized to work in the U.S./Sponsorships are not available

Summary:
My client is looking for a DevOps Engineer who wants to be part of a growing Cloud and DevOps team. tags: DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=0, other=0, dotnet=2, c=0, mobile=1, go=0, nodejs=0, bigdata-ml=0, ruby=0, apple=0, java=2, gamedev=0, php=0, embedded=0, frontend=0}
items.content: Position Sr. SOA Integration Engineer Location Los Angeles, CA Duration 12+ Months Job Description The Sr. SOA Integration Engineer designs and builds LA Care's SOA integration solutions as part of the Enterprise Integration Services team, working with the architecture, business, application and IT infrastructure teams. The Sr. SOA Integration Engineer will analyse business and technical problems and develop the appropriate the SOABPELBAM framework to incorporate Master Data, event driven and batch processing entities to the master service bus. The ideal candidate would be an excellent communicator and relationship builder, with the ability to discuss and understand HealthCare business partners across all operations. This person must be well organized, flexible, motivated and enjoy the challenges of supporting a complex, changing environment, with attention to detail, at times under pressure, remaining flexible, proactive, resourceful and efficient. The ideal candidate will build relationships throughout business units, our customers, and their teams to ensure that the services provided are of exceptional quality. Standard Duties and Responsibilities Develops SOA integration and Business Workflow detailed design and code to meet the business needs of the company by working closely with key architects, stakeholders and partners. Supports in-house project teams to implement SOA integration solutions. Leads both onsite and offshore engineers when needed. Provides technical guidance to various departments. Works closely with development teams to ensure compliance with LAC architecture guidelines and engineering standards. Supports and creates detailed design documents, process documents, standards documents and governance documents. Collaborates with enterprise architects across the organization on the details of the systems architecture for their particular domain. Works closely with IT Solutions Delivery areas to identify and resolve integration and workflow considerations and issues. Delivers solutions on schedule and provides accurate work estimates for work assignments. Assists with POC s for overall system design and architecture validity. Integrates IT Solutions into a common SOABPELBAM bus framework. Follows and enforces standards around systems technology stacks and mechanisms for governing cloud-based infrastructure. Preferred Degree Master s Degree Required Major Bachelor s Degree in Computer Science, Business Adm. or related field Major Bachelor s Degree in Business I.T. or related field Years of DirectRelevant Experience Required 7 to 10 years of experience Describe the types of previous job experience required 10 years of experience in design and implementation of ORACLEPLSQL andor SQL Server Batch processes. 7 years of experience writing JAVA applications. 5 years of experience designing and building solutions with ORACLE SOA suite 12c (ESBBPELSOABAM). Strong experience of leading advanced technical resources. Strong understanding of process and queuing design patterns. Excellent writing skills. Demonstrated experience designing and building enterprise level canonical models. Experience in multiple database platforms, including NoSQL, SQL Server and Oracle. Experience working with end users to understand requirements, high level designs and build technical solutions from concept to implementation. Previous healthcare experience is preferred. Strong problem-solving and analytical ability. Thanks, Ram Chapala Mythri Consulting LLC.

items.content:
Integration Engineer at Dragos

Remote
  • REMOTE
  • ENGINEERING
  • FULL-TIME

Do you want to make a meaningful contribution to society by securing critical infrastructure and knowing that your work was impactful? Our software codifies our knowledge and experience, delivering an intelligent, orchestrated, and automated approach to asset protection, threat detection, analysis, and response. The Dragos Platform is not just an application we sell to our customers, it is the solution that our Threat Operations Center (TOC) uses; a scalable tool able to protect the most sophisticated ICS infrastructures.

Dragos is looking for a self-motivated and enthusiastic software engineer interested in developing solutions to help safeguard the world’s industrial infrastructure in a highly collaborative team at Dragos. We set our goal as best in class and are looking for team players who set these same standards for themselves.

Responsibilities

  • Design and build robust, high-volume, low-latency applications for interacting with 3rd party applications, extending functionality of the Dragos Platform and partner applications.
  • Write well-designed, testable, and efficient code
  • Contribute in all phases of the development lifecycle
  • Prepare and produce releases of software components
  • Support continuous improvement by investigating and presenting alternative technologies for team review

Requirements

  • 3-5 years of hands-on experience with Python, Flask, and Django
  • Experience building and interacting with REST APIs.
  • Experience building highly-scalable, concurrent, large-volume applications
  • Experience with microservice system architecture and design patterns
  • Experience with enterprise message Queues such as AQMP, MQTT, Kafka, etc.
  • Experience configuring IP based networks and Software Defined Networking (SDN) is a plus
  • Ability to understand and design how multiple systems can interact to improve functionality in the entire ecosystem
  • Ability to work collaboratively with the team to brainstorm solutions
  • Ability to multitask on several complex programming assignments while simultaneously balancing multiple deadlines and priorities
  • Knowledge of software development principles and design patterns
  • Personal initiative, self-motivation, and results-oriented work ethic and ability to work independently with minimal supervision

Dragos seeks passionate, hard-working, fun-loving, small-ego, big-brained people. Our tagline is “Safeguarding Civilization” not because we think highly of ourselves, but because the problems we are solving are critically important, today and in the years to come. We look for ICS experts across industries who are committed to growing global expertise in the space by training the next wave of future innovators and thought leaders. We offer competitive salary, equity, full benefits (medical, dental, vision, disability, and life insurance-all 100% covered) and 6% match-401K.

Dragos is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace dedicated to pursuing and hiring a diverse workforce. Come join us! Come join us!
